description: Object description coming soon __________________________________ In 2019’s Brazilian Astrophotography Meeting I shot the region around Altair “E” for about 2h at 200mm. When processing the file, I figured it would be nice to incorporate more data from my images of the same region from 2018. Then, I added an extra 2h shot with the Samyang 135mm, in what ended up being a 2-panel mosaic. At the end, 3 integrated masters were merged, with equivalent field of a 1x2-panel mosaic, with extra detail around the “E”, data from the 200mm lens. The Milky Way dark clouds contrast with the myriad of stars, and the yellow-coloured Milky Way shines brightly. The field has a lot of faint dust, especially around Altair. Here is my processing of this beautiful Northern field. Constructive criticism, comments and suggestions are more than welcome in the comments section. Dates: 11 Aug 2018, 7 Sep 2019 and 30 July 2019 Locations: MG and 12th EBA, GO, Brazil. Dark-Rural Skies (Bortle 2-3, calculated SQM ~21.4-21.7) Camera: Canon EOS T5/1200D (mod) at ISO 800 | Canon EOS T4i/650D (stock) at ISO 1600 Optics: Samyang 135mm f/2 operated at f/2.4 | Tamron 70-200mm f/2.8 @ 200/3.5 Mount: Sky-Watcher HEQ5, tracking, guiding Exposure Detail: 31x120s +22x120s + 70x120s = Total 246 min = 4h
title: Dark Clouds Around Altair
